pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:0.5: 12. The training rule on light cloaks
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.3: On one occasion when the weather was warm, king Pasenadi of Kosala dressed in an expensive linen cloak and went to Thullanandā. He bowed and sat down.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.4: And Thullanandā instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.7: “Great king, if you wish to give me something, then give me this linen cloak.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.8: The king gave her his cloak. He then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated her with his right side toward her, and left.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.10: “These nuns have great desires; they are not content.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.11: How can they ask the king for his linen cloak?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.12: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.13: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.14: “How could Venerable Thullanandā ask the king for his linen cloak?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.15: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā asked for this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.18: “… How can the nun Thullanandā ask the king for his linen cloak?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.19: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.20: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.21: ‘If a nun carries out an exchange to get a light cloak, it is to be worth at most two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins. If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.2: whatever cloak is used in warm weather.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.3: Carries out an exchange to get:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.5: It is to be worth at most two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.6: it may be worth ten _kahāpaṇa_ coins.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.7: If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.8: if she asks for one worth more than that, then the effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.9: When she obtains it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.10: It is to be relinquished to the Sangha of nuns, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.11: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.12: (To be expanded as in Nuns’ Relinquishment 1, [](pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21--2.1.43), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.13: ‘Venerables, this light cloak worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins which I got in exchange is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.17: If it is worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins, and she perceives it as more, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.18: If it is worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins, but she is unsure if it is, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.19: If it is worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins, but she perceives it as worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.20: If it is worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins, but she perceives it as worth more than two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.21: If it is worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.22: If it is worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins, and she perceives it as worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṃsa_ coins, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.2: if she carries out an exchange for one worth at most two-and-a-half _kaṃsas_;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.3: if she carries out an exchange for one worth less than two-and-a-half _kaṃsas_;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.5: if it is from those who have invited;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.6: if it is for the benefit of someone else;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.7: if it is by means of her own property;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.8: if she gets one in exchange that has little value from someone who wants to exchange one of great value;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.10: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.11: The twelfth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.14: “Venerables, the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.15: In regard to this I ask you,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.21: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.22: The chapter on offenses entailing relinquishment in the nuns’ analysis is finished.
